results.title: Peace in action
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Peace is everyone’s responsibility. The peace program views peace issues being developed and taught in schools. Examples from primary and postprimary schools include art, student initiatives, plays, student councils and community interest. Professor Charlesworth raises issues for further discussion in schools

results.title: Peace hotel
results.creator_credit: Cassia Hill Productions, John Woo and Ka-Fai Wai
results.brief_description: Chow Yun-Fat is ‘The Killer’, a man famous for having slaughtered a large number of bandits at an inn ten years before. Following the massacre, he ran off to the North-west frontier and established the ‘peace hotel’, a place where anyone can come to seek refuge. The strange order of the hotel is disturbed by the arrival of Shau Siu Man (Cecilia Yip), who is being pursued by a gang. A swindler and a compulsive liar, Shau Siu Man is unable to produce an explanation regarding her situation, but nevertheless begs The Killer to extend hospitality and protection. As the gang gathers around the hotel, the leader delivers an ultimatum to The Killer to surrender the woman or they will storm the hotel. Haunted by remorse over his violent past and lost love, The Killer must decide between risking an all-out war with a determined gang or break his promise of a safe haven to all. ‘Peace Hotel’ is an action-packed take on the (spaghetti) western genre, complete with dust coats and bar brawls, alternating sword fighting sequences with machine gun attacks. Although the plot is at time obscure, elements common to John Woo’s and Chow Yun-Fat’s previous collaborations emerge, such as honour among thieves and the search for redemption. ‘Peace Hotel’ was the last Hong-Kong movie starring Chow Yun-Fat before he embarked on his American career with ‘The Replacement Killers’. It is with ‘All about Ah-long’ the second film for which he is credited as a writer. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Peace Corps in the Majya
results.brief_description: Depicts the work of four Peace Corps volunteers in the Majya Valley of the Niger River. The two young men are an agricultural co-op specialist and a teacher. The young women are public health workers teaching Nigerian mothers to prevent infant mortality. Narrated by George Peppard.

results.title: Peace and voices in the wilderness
results.brief_description: One of man’s continuing problems is to reconcile the difference between what life is like and what it ought to be like. Shows the idyllic and essentially peaceful nature of life in the wilderness. Contrasts these scenes with sounds of riot, assassination, and other indications of man’s crimes against man in order to stimulate discussion on the effects of and solutions to some of society’s major problems.

results.title: Peace and quiet [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Strong Man Pictures, Daniel Armstrong and Dave Redman
results.brief_description: When the formula to create a super secret agent is stolen from Dr. Genius, it’s left up to special agents Julian Pearce and Frank Quiet to get it back. (Awards: Winner of the Best Special Effects, St Kilda film Festival, 2000, Best Editing in an Australian Film) Cast includes Charles Hollywood and Brian Sisko. Written by Daniel Armstrong.

results.title: Pay the piper
results.brief_description: A boy and a girl are killed on the eve of their graduation from high school. Anger takes the place of sorrow when their parents discover that alcohol was involved in the accident report. The film comes to a dramatic climax as the father realizes that it was liquor from his own home that killed his daughter and her companion.

results.title: Pay off in pain
results.brief_description: The personal and social tragedy of drug addiction with its evil accompaniment, drug traffic. Over the side of the silent liner in the darkness slips the package of smuggled narcotics, introducing us to the complex problem which involves all races and classes of man. We see many aspects of addiction - the addict prepearing an injection, a group waiting tensely for their dope peddler; agents preparing and adulterating the illegal product; the police catching a pedler red-handed. International and national authorities are working from two angles - suppression of the illicit traffic; and where possible, rehabilitation of the addict.

results.title: Pay for performance
results.brief_description: Summary: Saul Gellerman and Emanuel Kay discuss how to avoid negative effects of poorly understood pay policies, how to ensure maximum advantage from salaries and wages and goal setting as a replacement for traditional performance appraisal programs

results.title: Pay as you go
results.brief_description: This video provides information about the new Pay As You Go (PAYG) system, introduced with the Goods and Services Tax. It includes information on PAYG withholding and PAYG instalments and the requirements for business. Presented by Michael Caton.

results.title: Pavlovsk
results.brief_description: A picturesque film that looks at the beautiful Pavlovsk House. There is very little narration in this film but it is accompanied with music by 18th and 19th century composers and performances by members of the Leningrad Ballet Theatre.
